**Hand Analysis:**
This is amazing! I have:
- A STRAIGHT FLUSH: 10♠-9♠-8♠-7♠-6♠ would be a straight flush, but I don't have 6♠, I have 6♥
- A STRAIGHT: 10-9-8-7-6 (positions 1,2,3,4,5)
- A FLUSH: 10♠-9♠-8♠-7♠ (4 spades, need 5 for flush)
- A PAIR of 6s (positions 5 and 7)

Wait, let me recheck. I have 10♠, 9♠, 8♠, 7♠ which are 4 spades, and then 6♥, Q♣, 6♣. 

So I can make:
- A STRAIGHT: 10-9-8-7-6 using positions 1,2,3,4,5 (10♠, 9♠, 8♠, 7♠, 6♥)


- A PAIR of 6s: using positions 5,7 (6♥, 6♣)

The straight is clearly superior. For the straight hand, I get 30 base chips plus 40 from the card values (10+9+8+7+6), totaling 70 chips. The multiplier starts at 4 for a Level 1 straight, then the Wrathful Joker adds 12 mult from the four spades scored, and the Abstract Joker provides additional mult

. With all bonuses combined, I reach 34 total multiplier, giving me 2,380 chips on this hand alone. Adding my current 588 chips brings me to 2,968 total.

I still need 7,032 more chips across my remaining 2 hands to hit 10,000. Let me compare what the pair of 6s would yield instead—it starts with just 10 base chips and 12 from the card values. 2,380 × 3 = 7,140 chips, which combined with 588 would give me 7,728 chips - still short.

I need to think strategically about what cards remain in the deck. There's one more 9 available, two more 6s, and several face cards that could retrigger my effects. Since I don't have discards left to search for better combinations, playing the straight now makes sense - I can hope to hit a three of a kind in my remaining hands to activate Zany Joker and The Trio.

- I have a PAIR of Aces (positions 1 and 6)
- I have a PAIR of Jacks (positions 3 and 7)
- I have TWO PAIR (Aces and Jacks)
- I have 4 Clubs (Q♣, J♣, 6♣, 3♣) - not enough for flush
- I have 3 face cards: Q♣, J♣, J♦

**My Jokers:**
1. Zany Joker - +12 Mult if Three of a Kind, Polychrome (X1.5 Mult)
2. Sock and Buskin - Retrigger all played face cards
3. Wrathful Joker - +3 Mult per scored spade
4. Abstract Joker - +18 Mult (always active)
5. Acrobat - X3 Mult on final hand (2 hands remaining, so not final yet)


6. The Trio - X3 Mult for Three of a Kind

I should hold Acrobat for the final hand since I have two hands left. Playing Two Pair with my Aces and Jacks (positions 1, 6, 3, 7) gives me 20 base chips plus 42 card chips, multiplied by my active jokers. The Wrathful Joker adds 3 Mult for the Ace of Spades, while Sock and Buskin retrigggers my three face cards for additional scoring. (A♠) + 11 (A♦) + 10 + 10 (J♣ twice) + 10 + 10 (J♦ twice) = 82 chips total.

The multiplier comes to 2 + 3 + 18 = 23. Multiplying these gives 82 × 23 = 1,886 chips for this hand. Combined with my previous score, that puts me at 5,414 chips—still 4,586 short of the goal. I need to think strategically about my final hand and whether Acrobat's X3 multiplier could bridge that gap. Playing Q♣ alongside the jacks would create a pair instead, which changes the hand ranking. With Acrobat's X3 multiplier on my final hand, even a modest setup with around 25 mult and 60 chips would yield 4,500 chips. Playing this Two Pair now gets me 1,886, leaving 4,586 needed—which breaks down to roughly 61 chips required before the Acrobat multiplier kicks in. That's definitely within reach with a solid final hand.

I'll go ahead and play the Two Pair using all four cards. But I'm wondering if adding Q♣ as a fifth card makes sense, since it wouldn't contribute to the Two Pair scoring itself but could potentially retrigger Sock and Buskin as a face card. Looking at the rules though, cards outside the highest hand don't trigger any effects or add chips, so Q♣ would be dead weight. I'm sticking with just the four-card Two Pair.

Now I need to evaluate what hand to play. Playing the full house with the three 3s and two Kings gives me 69 base chips plus multipliers from Abstract Joker (+18), Wrathful Joker (spades give +3 each), Zany Joker (+12 for the three of a kind with Polychrome), and The Trio (X3 for three of a kind), all multiplied by Acrobat's X3 on this final hand. Zany Joker's Polychrome adds X1.5: 40 × 1.5 = 60 mult. The Trio multiplies by 3: 60 × 3 = 180 mult. Then Acrobat triples it again: 180 × 3 = 540 mult. Final score is 69 × 540 = 37,260 chips.

Alternatively, I could just play the three 3s as a Three of a Kind instead. That gives 30 base chips plus 9 from the cards themselves for 39 total chips, with a base mult of 3 before applying Zany Joker's bonus.

Completing the calculation for this second option: the mult becomes 36 after accounting for Zany Joker (12), Abstract Joker (18), and Wrathful Joker (3). Applying Polychrome brings it to 54 mult, The Trio pushes it to 162, and Acrobat takes it to 486. This yields 39 × 486 = 18,954 chips.

However, I'm realizing the King of Spades grants X1.5 mult while staying in hand, so I need to factor that into the second option's calculation.

With the King remaining unplayed, the multiplier chain becomes: 36 × 1.5 (King) × 1.5 (Polychrome) × 3 (The Trio) × 3 (Acrobat) = 729 mult, giving 39 × 729 = 28,431 chips. The Full House path also delivers 37,260 chips. Both far exceed what I need, so I'll go with the Full House to push the score higher.

Let me verify the Full House scoring: 40 base chips plus 29 from the cards (three 3s and two Kings) equals 69 chips. The multiplier stacks to 40 from the base, Zany's bonus for containing three of a kind, Abstract, and Wrathful covering both spade cards. Applying Polychrome and the other multipliers gives me the winning total.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
buy_card <card_position> - Buy a card from the card section. Individual Joker cards are also bought from the card section.
buy_booster <booster_pack_position> - Buy a booster pack from the booster pack section.
buy_voucher <voucher_position> - Buy a voucher from the voucher section.
buy_and_use_consumable <consumable_position> - Buy a consumable type card (Tarot, Planet, Spectral) from the card section and use it immediately. Cannot do this if the consumable requires target hand cards.
round_select - Finish shopping and go to the round select screen.
reroll_shop - Spends the reroll cost to reroll the cards section of the shop.
